intro: Corydalis omeiana, commonly known as the Omean Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has slender, creeping stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of horticultural circles.
